players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the detective.
Night 1 begins.
Bob was found dead.
You investigated Charlie and discovered that they are the mafioso.
Day 1 begins.
You: "I investigated Charlie last night and he is the mafioso. We need to vote him out today."
Charlie: "Alice is lying. I am a villager and she is trying to frame me. Bob was a good person and I don't know who killed him."
Diana: "Alice, if you're the detective, why did you investigate Charlie instead of Bob? That seems odd since Bob was the one killed."

Charlie: "Diana, you're right. Alice's story doesn't add up. If she's the detective and Bob was killed, why didn't she investigate Bob? It makes more sense that she's trying to deflect suspicion from herself by accusing me."
Diana: "I am voting for Alice. Her claim doesn't make sense and she's likely the mafia trying to frame Charlie."
You: "I investigated Charlie because I suspected him from the start. Why would I investigate Bob when he was already dead? That makes no sense. Charlie is lying."
